subject: Your daily e-mail from the BBC
body:
Thursday, 14 June, 2007, 18:00 GMT 14:00 -04:00:Canada/Eastern














Search BBC Sport 













FOOTBALL




Barton completes move to Magpies
Manchester City midfielder Joey Barton signs for Newcastle United for £5.8m.



 
Chelsea secure deal for Ben Haim
Chelsea sign Bolton's out-of-contract defender Tal Ben Haim on a four-year deal.



 
Man Utd open up against Reading
Man Utd begin their Premier League defence at home to Reading, while Sam Allardyce returns to old club Bolton for his first match as Newcastle boss.








GOLF




Live - US Open 2007
Nick Spieherty leads at two under as the first round of the US Open gathers pace at Oakmont.



 
Spieherty storms to Oakmont lead
England's Nick Spieherty cards a two-under 68 at Oakmont to claim the early clubhouse lead during the first round of the US Open.



 
US Open clubhouse scores
Latest scores from Oakmont.








MOTORSPORT




Hamilton set for Indianapolis bow
Lewis Hamilton says he has not even practised on a simulator for Indianapolis as he prepares for his US Grand Prix debut this weekend.



 
Aussie Stoner extends Ducati deal
MotoGP world championship leader Casey Stoner extends his contract with Ducati until the end of 2008.



 
India agree deal on Grand Prix
The Indian Olympic Association says it has an agreement to stage a Grand Prix in New Delhi from 2009.








FORMULA ONE




Hamilton set for Indianapolis bow
Lewis Hamilton says he has not even practised on a simulator for Indianapolis as he prepares for his US Grand Prix debut this weekend.



 
India agree deal on Grand Prix
The Indian Olympic Association says it has an agreement to stage a Grand Prix in New Delhi from 2009.



 
Button wants Indianapolis revival
Jenson Button hopes some fun around the Indianapolis Motor Speedway this weekend can banish the frustrations of a poor season so far.








ATHLETICS




Powell eyes Golden League repeat
Asafa Powell steps his quest for a first global 100m crown at Friday's Golden League opener in Norway.



 
Tomlinson leap boosts Cup hopes
Long jumper Chris Tomlinson produces his best effort for nearly three years in Prague ahead of the European Cup.



 
Williams desperate for comeback
Welsh 400m hurdler Rhys Williams admits to frustration as injury keeps him out of the European Cup squad.








CYCLING




Moreau wins to boost Libere hopes
Christophe Moreau claims a solo win in stage four of the Dauphine Libere to climb to second overall.



 
Hammond eyes Tour de France spot
Briton Roger Hammond heads to the Tour de Suisse on Saturday hoping to secure a spot at next month's Tour de France.



 
Vinokourov lays down Tour marker
Tour de France favourite Alexander Vinokourov takes the Dauphine Libere lead after a trademark time-trial display in the third stage.
